author: Michael Larabel
description: Linux 6.17-rc2 is now available to facilitate the latest weekly testing of the Linux 6.17 kernel...
title: Linux 6.17-rc2 Released With Performance Fixes & More

author: Michael Larabel
description: Last week I ran some early Linux 6.17 benchmarks showing some improvements and regressions when testing with AMD Ryzen AI Max "Strix Halo". Since then there have been some performance regression fixes along with addressing other early fallout from this fresh kernel code. Repeating the tests now on the latest Linux 6.17 Git state ahead of today's Linux 6.17-rc2 tagging is showing some nice improvements and fixes from the code churn this week...
title: Linux 6.17 Performance Looking Even Better After Early Fallout Addressed

author: Michael Larabel
description: One of the new exciting security features with Linux 6.17 is Attack Vector Controls as a means of easier managing CPU security mitigations depending upon the system/server use-case. It drastically simplifies CPU security mitigation management for only activating the mitigations relevant to intended use. With the Linux 6.17-rc2 kernel due out later today, Attack Vector Controls refines its logic around the Speculative Return Stack Overflow (SRSO) mitigation...
title: Linux 6.17-rc2 To Better Tune Attack Vector Controls For SRSO Mitigation

author: Michael Larabel
description: Merged this week as part of the sound fixes for the Linux 6.17 cycle and now to be back-ported to the stable kernel versions is a headset detection fix/workaround for the Framework 13 Laptop powered by the AMD Ryzen AI 300 series...
title: Linux Merges Headset Detection Workaround For Framework 13 Ryzen AI 300 Series

author: Michael Larabel
description: Released last month was Shotcut 25.07 with many improvements to this popular open-source and cross platform video editor. Released today was Shotcut 25.08 to provide more fixes atop that latest video editor release...
title: Shotcut 25.08 Brings More Bug Fixes To This Open-Source Video Editor
